params.amount: The amount of liquidity to provide.

applyAllowListUpdates(address[],address[.details: allowListing will be removed before public launch

params.offRamps: A list of offRamps and their new permission status/rate limits
params.onRamps: A list of onRamps and their new permission status/rate limits

returns._0: true if the pool can accept liquidity, false otherwise.
true is enabled, false if not.

params.provider: The address for which to get the balance.

returns._0: true if the given address is a permissioned offRamp.
true if the given address is a permissioned onRamp.

lockOrBurn(address,bytes,uint256,uint64,.details: The whenHealthy check is important to ensure that even if a ramp is compromised we're able to stop token movement via ARM.

releaseOrMint(bytes,address,uint256,uint.details: The whenHealthy check is important to ensure that even if a ramp is compromised we're able to stop token movement via ARM.

params.amount: The amount of liquidity to remove.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[EIP section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

acceptOwnership().notice: Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient.

addLiquidity(uint256).notice: Adds liquidity to the pool. The tokens should be approved first.

applyAllowListUpdates(address[],address[.notice: Apply updates to the allow list.

applyRampUpdates((address,bool,(bool,uin.notice: Sets permissions for all on and offRamps.

canAcceptLiquidity().notice: Checks if the pool can accept liquidity.

currentOffRampRateLimiterState(address).notice: Gets the token bucket with its values for the block it was requested at.

currentOnRampRateLimiterState(address).notice: Gets the token bucket with its values for the block it was requested at.

getAllowListEnabled().notice: Gets whether the allowList functionality is enabled.

getLockReleaseInterfaceId().notice: returns the lock release interface flag used for EIP165 identification.

getProvidedLiquidity(address).notice: Gets the amount of provided liquidity for a given address.

getToken().notice: Gets the IERC20 token that this pool can lock or burn.

isOffRamp(address).notice: Checks whether something is a permissioned offRamp on this contract.

isOnRamp(address).notice: Checks whether something is a permissioned onRamp on this contract.

lockOrBurn(address,bytes,uint256,uint64,.notice: Locks the token in the pool

releaseOrMint(bytes,address,uint256,uint.notice: Release tokens from the pool to the recipient

removeLiquidity(uint256).notice: Removed liquidity to the pool. The tokens will be sent to msg.sender.

setOffRampRateLimiterConfig(address,(boo.notice: Sets the offramp rate limited config.

setOnRampRateLimiterConfig(address,(bool.notice: Sets the onramp rate limited config.

transferOwnership(address).notice: Allows an owner to begin transferring ownership to a new address, pending.

documentation.text: @dev The unique lock release pool flag to signal through EIP 165.

@dev Whether or not the pool accepts liquidity.
 External liquidity is not required when there is one canonical token deployed to a chain,
 and CCIP is facilitating mint/burn on all the other chains, in which case the invariant
 balanceOf(pool) on home chain == sum(totalSupply(mint/burn "wrapped" token) on all remote chains) should always hold
@notice returns the lock release interface flag used for EIP165 identification.

@notice Checks if the pool can accept liquidity.
 @return true if the pool can accept liquidity, false otherwise.

@notice Adds liquidity to the pool. The tokens should be approved first.
 @param amount The amount of liquidity to provide.

@notice Removed liquidity to the pool. The tokens will be sent to msg.sender.
 @param amount The amount of liquidity to remove.
